# Draft:Henry Edward Watkins

THERE ARE TWO HERE
Henry Watkins and Henry E. Watkins should link here
Henry Edward Watkins (1782?-1856) was a lawyer and politician in Virginia. He served in the Virginia House of Delegates and the Virginia Senate]]. War of 1812
He lived in Prince Edward County, Virginia.
He attended Hampden-Sydney College, Washington College, Princeton (A.B.) and William & Mary for law. He married Agnes daughter of Samuel Woodson and Mary n√©e Carrington Venable. Born at  "Poplar Hill", now more commonly known as the Dunnington Mansion (Dunnington Tobacco Company). The mansion has a long history. Lived nearby at "The Home" where he ran a law school?
He served as Commonwealth of Virginia Attorney 1810-1813; House of Delegates member 1812-1833; Virginia Senate 1833-1834.
See also
*Farmville Historic District (Farmville, Virginia)

1839-1902?
Henry Edward Watkins was a doctor and politician in Virginia. He was a surgeon in the Confederate army.
Francis Nathaniel Watkins was his sone and Asa D. Watkins one of his many grandchildren.
